results.title: Do you believe in ghosts?
results.brief_description: A young John Straford again stars in this editing exercise as a skeptic whose compusure is shaken by a very untoward event. The back garden sets the scene.

results.title: How to make a movie
results.brief_description: Although short and largely created to practise the Straford Brothers’ unique approach to editing and transitions, this already shows their ambitions for scene and story. Here, a frustrated filmmaker tries to make a ‘classic.’

results.title: Little Claude - a'hunting he will go
results.brief_description: The Straford Brothers’ first attempt at a hand drawn animation. Frank recalls that it was done by drawing on a single cell, filming it, then rubbing it out and drawing the next frame on top, “a pretty laborious way to make an animation.”

results.title: ARTV
results.brief_description:
The Australian Centre for the Moving Image and SBS Independent will commission 16 artists to produce works for ARTV, an exhibition program which will be broadcast on SBS and shown on screens throughout ACMI concurrently, commencing on 8 June 2004.

ARTV is part of 2004, a survey exhibition of contemporary Australian visual culture presented by the Australian Centre for the Moving Image and the National Gallery of Victoria.

results.title: Hello
results.brief_description: ‘Hello’ is it me you’re looking for?’ A wildly imaginative love story about love across the digital-analogue divides. Can an almost obsolete cassette head speak the language of love with only fast forward and rewind to work with?
results.description: ‘Hello’ is it me you’re looking for?’ A wildly imaginative love story about love across the digital-analogue divides. Can an almost obsolete cassette head speak the language of love with only fast forward and rewind to work with?

results.title: Project the right image
results.brief_description:
English production, NOT made by the Department of Agriculture.

Details hot to and how not to project a 16mm film using a social church gathering as the backdrop. Stars a bumbling projectionist and a priest who first do everything the wrong way and then do everything the correct way.

Comical (in a daggy way) throughout with good use of slapstick humour. Also contains an amusing, very dry voiceover.

results.title: Green Fingers: Planting Evergreens
results.brief_description: ‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Planting Evergreens’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to correctly plant evergreen trees and shrubs in your garden, accompanied by a narrator explaining the method and techniques. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.

The episodes of Green Fingers are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of Sow What, Better Homes and Gardens, and Gardening Australia.

results.title: Infected
results.material_description: video, circular screen, projection, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Infected is a projected video installation about the nature of the physical body in the context of future technological possibilities, seen through dance and digitally manipulated imagery. The new bio-engineered body is still a sexual, stark, brutal, organic, pounding bloody system with ripping tendons. It is beautiful and repulsive, indulgent, curious, emotional, un/controlled, breeding, changing.

Gina Czarnecki is an artist originating from the UK whose films and installations have been exhibited widely across the UK and around the world. Infected continues her work around the visceral, biological and emotive body and its politics in relation to new technologies.

This video is made in collaboration with Iona Kewney, a Glasgow-based dance artist. It features a specially commissioned score by Fennesz, whose computer-manipulations of sounds derived from guitar and other acoustic sources have won him worldwide acclaim as one of the most innovative and important artists working in electronic music.
